title: Non-normative Decision-Making in Higher Education Institutions and Instructional Design Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: For general citizens without practical experience in university administration or curriculum design. Explores practical alternatives through uncertainty management and decision-making process analysis within organizations.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and explain three or more non-normative decision-making patterns in higher education institutions.
Learners can derive strategies to resolve ethical conflicts within organizations using reflective practice techniques.
Learners can model the balance between instructional design integrity and external pressures by applying the Reflexive Advocacy framework.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
